i found this document on edonkey:

Are you using Systran Premium 5 in Trial mode in your PC?

If so, here's a little trick to use it for more time than the limitation of the trial (there is another way, but requires the reinstallation of the Operative System - Windows XP). 
First make a note of the installation date. If you don't remember, use regedit and go to the following branch: [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionUninstall{53595300-0624-0001-3530-007072656D69} and search the following key - "InstallDate" (watch for the number - example: 20040922 - 2004-09-22).
Then and after the trial expiration, change the system date to a date inside the trial use of the software. One of the ways is by clicking with the right mouse button over the systray clock and clicking in the "Adjust Date/Time". You must exit the Systran Server before doing this operation. 
After this, you may use the software without any problem. Don't forget to put the system date back to normal, after the work with Systran has been done.
This way, you may stay with this big piece of software (that took time to install).

If you are looking for a "keygen" to activate this software in Emule, be careful with that. There are people doing the dirty job of putting "keygens" that are "trojan horses" or even "virus". If you have an old hard disk drive or even an old PC, test before using (even your antivirus may fail to find some recent treads).
There are "serials" divulgated in text files that are fake (do not work) or that where previously used to activate Systran Premium v5 (but are no longer working, since they have reached the activation limit).
If you know how to crack software or if you know someone that does that and wants to create a "keygen" for Systran, then I must tell that the good one for that job is one that makes the activation via phone. That means, checks the activation serial (here is an example of a good serial that has reached the activation limit: 502033-092535-701526-129070-328125) and checks for a challenge code that is generated by the configurations of the hardware of the PC (here is an example taken from my PC: 283296-489275-012201-399291). Then the keygen must generate a code that is able to unlock the activation of the software (the code has the same format that the challenge code - four code groups with the same size).
One good example of a "keygen" used for this king of software is the one used to activate Symantec Products (for example: Norton AntiVirus 2004).
